title: WHIRLING / KIM INTRO
description: Downstairs ltn Kim Kitsuragi - precinct 57th's finest - is waiting to solve THE HANGED MAN with you as an inter-district co-op. It would appear Precinct 41 sent you to investigate the lynching of a "Whitewater mercenary" in "Martinaise". And that you are indeed a police officer. Kim briefs you on the case and your relationship begins - likely on the wrong foot, but not necessarily.

dialogueTree.text: A bespectacled man in an orange bomber jacket has folded up his newspaper and is now tapping his foot on the floor. Looks like he's been waiting for quite some time.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "After catching your attention, he n..."
links.text: After catching your attention, he narrows his eyes and extends his hand in greeting.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "If an assault were launched on this..."
links.text: If an assault were launched on this building right now -- if the windows came crashing down and the whole world descended upon you -- this man would hurl himself in death's way to save you. You are sure of this -- but why?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "On the sleeve of his bomber jacket..."
links.text: On the sleeve of his bomber jacket -- as well as on its back -- are the same enigmatic white rectangles as on your blazer.

links.title: You: "Hold on, who is he to me?"
links.text: Hold on, who is he to me?

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He is your half-brother."
links.text: He is your half-brother.

links.title: You: "Shake his hand."
links.text: Shake his hand.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hello, I'm Kim Kitsuragi." His gri..."
links.text: "Hello, I'm Kim Kitsuragi." His grip is firm. "Lieutenant, Precinct 57. You must be from the 41st..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "You realize he is waiting for your..."
links.text: You realize he is waiting for your name.

links.title: Inland Empire: "This is your chance to come up with..."
links.text: This is your chance to come up with a really good name for yourself. Get *creative* -- conceptualize!

links.title: You: ""I don't really know my name.""
links.text: "I don't really know my name."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, then." He processes the info..."
links.text: "Okay, then." He processes the information, then disregards it.

links.title: You: ""Uh, I'm... maybe I'm Harry?""
links.text: "Uh, I'm... maybe I'm Harry?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You seem a little unsure, officer...."
links.text: "You seem a little unsure, officer. Have you spent too much time undercover lately?" He cracks an uneasy smile to let you know it's a joke.

links.title: You: ""Just call me *Officer*"."
links.text: "Just call me *Officer*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Very well. Officer..." He's slight..."
links.text: "Very well. Officer..." He's slightly confused.

links.title: You: "Invent a name for yourself."
links.text: Invent a name for yourself.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Concentration makes you squint your..."
links.text: Concentration makes you squint your eyes. Your name should be deep gold and orange, like a forest fire looming on the horizon, but mixed with the stench of liquor rising from your breath. You're two steps closer to it, but there are still many to go...

links.title: You: ""It is not yet time.""
links.text: "It is not yet time."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau."
links.text: Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau.

links.title: You: "It's so cool."
links.text: It's so cool.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "You instinctively run your hand ove..."
links.text: You instinctively run your hand over your multi-patterned orange tie. The sensation of wrinkled silk somehow makes the name sound even cooler.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Even classier. You should take this..."
links.text: Even classier. You should take this opportunity to start your life anew as a *classier* person -- as Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Yes, it is. Raphaël Ambrosius Coste..."
links.text: Yes, it is. Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau sounds solemn and historical. This is an opportunity to start your life anew as a *classier* person.

links.title: You: "It's very cool, but won't I come of..."
links.text: It's very cool, but won't I come off like a douche if I call myself that?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "You instinctively run your hand ove..."
links.text: You instinctively run your hand over the multi-patterned silk of your tie. Its slickness gives you comfort and reassurance.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Don't worry. Raphaël Ambrosius Cost..."
links.text: Don't worry. Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau sounds solemn and historical. Take this opportunity to start your life anew as a *classier* person.

links.title: Conceptualization: "No, you won't. Raphaël Ambrosius Co..."
links.text: No, you won't. Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau sounds solemn and historical. This is an opportunity to start your life anew as a *classier* person.

links.title: You: "It's very, very cool. But maybe jus..."
links.text: It's very, very cool. But maybe just a bit too... ostentatious?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "You instinctively run your hand ove..."
links.text: You instinctively run your hand over the multi-patterned silk of your tie. Its slickness gives you comfort and reassurance.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau is not os..."
links.text: Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau is not ostentatious, it's classy. This is an opportunity to start your life anew as a *classier* person.

links.title: Conceptualization: "No, it's not. Raphaël Ambrosius Cos..."
links.text: No, it's not. Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau sounds solemn and historical. This is an opportunity to start your life anew as a *classier* person.

links.title: You: ""My name is Raphaël Ambrosius Coste..."
links.text: "My name is Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, well..." He doesn't even proc..."
links.text: "Yes, well..." He doesn't even process what you just said, just moves on.

links.title: Drama: "Not for a moment does he believe th..."
links.text: Not for a moment does he believe that's your real name. He casts it aside as an intradepartmental joke or a peculiarity he doesn't understand.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like we had a little sche..."
links.text: "It looks like we had a little scheduling error on Sunday. Saturday too, actually... Have you had time to talk to the manager here?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "What he means is he has been trying..."
links.text: What he means is he has been trying to meet up with you for two days, but you have been *otherwise occupied*.

links.title: You: ""You mean him?" (Nod toward the Caf..."
links.text: "You mean him?" (Nod toward the Cafeteria Manager.) "Yeah, I just talked to him."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you don't mind, we should talk..."
links.text: "If you don't mind, we should talk to him again. Ask him for a run-down of the area -- now that I'm here as well. I understand the scene is out back, right?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "This man is doing you a professiona..."
links.text: This man is doing you a professional courtesy. He knows you haven't talked to the proprietor about whatever it was you were supposed to talk to him about.

links.title: You: ""You mean that guy?" (Nod toward th..."
links.text: "You mean that guy?" (Nod toward the man behind the counter.) "I *totally* talked to him."

links.title: You: ""No, I haven't.""
links.text: "No, I haven't."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then we should ask him for a run-d..."
links.text: "Then we should ask him for a run-down of the area, get me up to speed. I understand the scene is out back, right?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It also wouldn't hurt to assure hi..."
links.text: "It also wouldn't hurt to assure him the police are finally here. In full force, I mean. Have you mapped out the initial interviews?"

links.title: You: ""Who? You? You're with the police?""
links.text: "Who? You? You're with the police?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, of course.""
links.text: "Yes, of course."

links.title: You: ""Yes, the police. I'm aware I'm a p..."
links.text: "Yes, the police. I'm aware I'm a policeman."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right, and the interviews?" He tap..."
links.text: "Right, and the interviews?" He taps his foot -- more out of habit than impatience.

links.title: You: ""What interviews?""
links.text: "What interviews?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""At the 57th, we like to prepare an..."
links.text: "At the 57th, we like to prepare an initial list of persons of interest and then just... skim the surface." He gestures with his fingers. "Prepare the field, get to know the players. You don't do that? Maybe it's not an inter-district practice..."

links.title: You: ""I have. Yes.""
links.text: "I have. Yes."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. But even if you haven't, we'..."
links.text: "Good. But even if you haven't, we'll have time for that after we take a look at the coroner's case."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Have you removed the dead body fro..."
links.text: "Have you removed the dead body from the tree?"

links.title: You: ""Dead body?""
links.text: "Dead body?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mm-hmm.""
links.text: "Mm-hmm."

links.title: You: ""I don't like dead bodies.""
links.text: "I don't like dead bodies."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sure. But did you take it down fro..."
links.text: "Sure. But did you take it down from the tree?"

links.title: You: ""Look man, you know, yeah.""
links.text: "Look man, you know, yeah."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Does that mean the body is no long..."
links.text: "Does that mean the body is no longer in the tree?"

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So, the body is still in the tree...."
links.text: "So, the body is still in the tree..."

links.title: Empathy: "This is the first time you detect a..."
links.text: This is the first time you detect a weariness in the lieutenant's voice. It is obvious he would have preferred for the body to no longer be in the tree.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...where it has been hanging for s..."
links.text: "...where it has been hanging for seven days straight. We should go there as soon as we're done talking to the owner."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "What a shame. Get to it now. *Rip*..."
links.text: What a shame. Get to it now. *Rip* that body down from the tree.

links.title: You: ""Don't worry about the body. I'll r..."
links.text: "Don't worry about the body. I'll rip it down."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""After it's been up in a tree for t..."
links.text: "After it's been up in a tree for that long, any kind of ripping is inadvisable."

links.title: Interfacing: "Delicate goods. Filled with stinkin..."
links.text: Delicate goods. Filled with stinking horrors...

links.title: You: ""You think I'm a cop? I can't be a..."
links.text: "You think I'm a cop? I can't be a police officer! Look at me!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We all feel that way sometimes. Th..."
links.text: "We all feel that way sometimes. There is no such thing as a *police officer*, I'm afraid. What remains is that there is a dead body in the tree -- someone has to figure out who put it there. If we don't, no one else will."

links.title: Logic: "And then, soon after, dead bodies w..."
links.text: And then, soon after, dead bodies would be dangling from all the trees.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But first we have to take it down,..."
links.text: "But first we have to take it down," he concludes.

links.title: You: ""What if I told you I'm not really..."
links.text: "What if I told you I'm not really a police officer?"

links.title: You: ""How can you be so sure I'm from th..."
links.text: "How can you be so sure I'm from the police?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I was sent here to meet a detectiv..."
links.text: "I was sent here to meet a detective from Precinct 41. You have the insignia of the Citizens Militia on your sleeve and on your back." He points to your jacket.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I suppose you could be impersonati..."
links.text: "I suppose you could be impersonating him. You could have gotten the insignia from the black market or forged it. But for now I am going to set those possibilities aside. I'm not from the Inspectorate General."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Inspectorate General means internal..."
links.text: Inspectorate General means internal affairs. What he's saying is he's not from the *rat squad* and isn't supposed to suspect such things.

links.title: You: ""Ah, you mean the rat squad!""
links.text: "Ah, you mean the rat squad!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No need for derogatory terms. They..."
links.text: "No need for derogatory terms. They are only doing their job."

links.title: You: ""You mean internal affairs?""
links.text: "You mean internal affairs?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. But I am not them. I'm from C..."
links.text: "Yes. But I am not them. I'm from Criminal Investigation."

links.title: You: ""Uh... Inspectorate General?""
links.text: "Uh... Inspectorate General?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Internal affairs. And I'm not them..."
links.text: "Internal affairs. And I'm not them. I'm from Criminal Investigation."

links.title: You: ""You said insignia. These white rec..."
links.text: "You said insignia. These white rectangles, you mean?" (Point to your sleeve.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: You: ""But they're just white rectangles.""
links.text: "But they're just white rectangles."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They're not *just* white rectangle..."
links.text: "They're not *just* white rectangles. They bear a halogen watermark with the letters RCM and a pattern resembling the street grid of Revachol West."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I would ask you to step into the h..."
links.text: "I would ask you to step into the headlights of my motor carriage, but, again, it's none of my concern. I just need you to do your job."

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.text: "Okay then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods."
links.text: He nods.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I was to meet a detective from Pre..."
links.text: "I was to meet a detective from Precinct 41 at the Whirling-in-Rags who arrived here three days ago. I am told that that is how long you have been here. Besides, you match his description." He looks you over.

links.title: You: ""What description?""
links.text: "What description?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Precinct 41 said they were sending..."
links.text: "Precinct 41 said they were sending their most seasoned detective. And you certainly look... seasoned."

links.title: You: ""That's right! I'm a man for all se..."
links.text: "That's right! I'm a man for all seasons, baby!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sure. Though I would also suggest..."
links.text: "Sure. Though I would also suggest that you locate your blazer with your official insignia." He points to the white rectangle on his sleeve.

links.title: You: ""But they're just white rectangles.""
links.text: "But they're just white rectangles."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They're not *just* white rectangle..."
links.text: "They're not *just* white rectangles. They bear a halogen watermark with the letters RCM and a pattern resembling the street grid of Revachol West. I could step into the headlights of my Kineema and show you, but right now I just need you to do your job."

links.title: You: ""But shouldn't I have a badge or so..."
links.text: "But shouldn't I have a badge or something?" (Check your pockets.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You mean you don't have a badge?""
links.text: "You mean you don't have a badge?"

links.title: You: ""It was not on me when I woke up.""
links.text: "It was not on me when I woke up."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Losing your identification card is..."
links.text: "Losing your identification card is a *serious* matter. My vehicle has a shortwave -- you can use it to report your badge missing. I would advise you to locate it as quickly as possible. But getting the body down should still take precedence."

links.title: Volition: "Alright, come on now. If *he* hasn'..."
links.text: Alright, come on now. If *he* hasn't said anything about your lack of pants, no one will. You're only hurting yourself by not wearing them...

links.title: You: "(Pretend you found it.) "I have my..."
links.text: (Pretend you found it.) "I have my badge. I'm a police man and I have my badge."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh..." There's a moment's pause, t..."
links.text: "Oh..." There's a moment's pause, then he continues, carefully: "If you didn't have your badge then that would be very *bad*. You would need to report it on my shortwave. But since you *do* have it, we can go straight to the task at hand."

links.title: You: ""Oh.""
links.text: "Oh."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""However, I would also suggest that..."
links.text: "However, I would also suggest that you locate your blazer with your official insignia." He points to the white rectangle on his sleeve.

links.title: You: ""What if I have an uncanny doppelgä..."
links.text: "What if I have an uncanny doppelgänger?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You may have murdered the man I wa..."
links.text: "You may have murdered the man I was supposed to meet and are now impersonating him. You may be his twin, stepping in for his even more incapacitated brother out of loyalty and love."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But for now I am going to set thos..."
links.text: "But for now I am going to set those possibilities aside. I'm not from the Inspectorate General."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Inspectorate General means internal..."
links.text: Inspectorate General means internal affairs. What he's saying is he's not from the *rat squad* and isn't supposed to suspect such things.

links.title: You: ""Ah, you mean the rat squad!""
links.text: "Ah, you mean the rat squad!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No need for derogatory terms. They..."
links.text: "No need for derogatory terms. They are only doing their job."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Regardless, I would also suggest t..."
links.text: "Regardless, I would also suggest that you locate your blazer with your official insignia." He points to the white rectangle on his sleeve.

links.title: You: ""You mean internal affairs?""
links.text: "You mean internal affairs?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. But I am not them. I'm from C..."
links.text: "Yes. But I am not them. I'm from Criminal Investigation."

links.title: You: ""Uh... Inspectorate General?""
links.text: "Uh... Inspectorate General?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Internal affairs. And I'm not them..."
links.text: "Internal affairs. And I'm not them. I'm from Criminal Investigation."

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.text: "Okay then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods."
links.text: He nods.

links.title: You: ""But I can't remember anything.""
links.text: "But I can't remember anything."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can see you drank last night, an..."
links.text: "I can see you drank last night, and the night before," he says after a moment of silence. "And that you are still drunk now. But I have seen officers go through worse. Much worse."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you need something for your hea..."
links.text: "If you need something for your headache, there is a general store nearby. But, as I said, the dead body should be our number one concern."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Yeah, a painkiller would be good ab..."
links.text: Yeah, a painkiller would be good about now. This thing is *pulsating* with discomfort.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "The best cure for a headache is, of..."
links.text: The best cure for a headache is, of course, morphine. They won't have that, so cigarettes will have to do.

links.title: You: ""What were we supposed to do again?""
links.text: "What were we supposed to do again?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Talk to the manager. Then we go ou..."
links.text: "Talk to the manager. Then we go out back and take the body down."

links.title: You: ""Let's go." [Leave.]"
links.text: "Let's go." [Leave.]

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""After you, officer.""
links.text: "After you, officer."

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "Lieutenant Kitsuragi is now in your..."
links.text: Lieutenant Kitsuragi is now in your party. You can talk to him whenever, by interacting with him.

links.title: Logic: "If you're about to embark on an inv..."
links.text: If you're about to embark on an investigation, shouldn't you have a badge?

links.title: You: ""Wait, shouldn't I have a badge or..."
links.text: "Wait, shouldn't I have a badge or something?" (Check your pockets.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You mean you don't have a badge?""
links.text: "You mean you don't have a badge?"

links.title: You: ""It wasn't on me when I woke up.""
links.text: "It wasn't on me when I woke up."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Losing your identification card is..."
links.text: "Losing your identification card is a *serious* matter. My vehicle has a shortwave -- you can use it to report your badge missing. I advise you to try to locate it as quickly as possible. But getting the body down should still take precedence."

links.title: Volition: "Alright, come on now. If *he* hasn'..."
links.text: Alright, come on now. If *he* hasn't said anything about your lack of pants, no one will. You're only hurting yourself by not wearing them...

links.title: You: "(Pretend you found it.) "I have my..."
links.text: (Pretend you found it.) "I have my badge! I'm a policeman and I have my badge."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh..." There's a moment's pause, t..."
links.text: "Oh..." There's a moment's pause, then he continues, obviously relieved: "If you didn't have your badge then that would be very *bad*. You would need to report it on my shortwave. But since you *do* have it, we can go straight to the task at hand."

links.title: You: ""Completely.""
links.text: "Completely."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Completely? Does that mean you too..."
links.text: "Completely? Does that mean you took the body down from the tree?"

links.title: You: ""I haven't.""
links.text: "I haven't."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. We'll have time for that aft..."
links.text: "Okay. We'll have time for that after we take a look at the coroner's case."

links.title: You: ""There must be some kind of a misun..."
links.text: "There must be some kind of a misunderstanding. You're taking me for someone else."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, I don't think so." He studies..."
links.text: "No, I don't think so." He studies you briefly. "We should ask him for a run-down of the area now that I'm here as well. I understand the scene is out back, right?"

links.title: You: "Don't shake his hand."
links.text: Don't shake his hand.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hello, I'm Kim Kitsuragi." He look..."
links.text: "Hello, I'm Kim Kitsuragi." He looks unfazed. "Lieutenant, Precinct 57. You must be from the 41st..."

links.title: Empathy: "It's barely noticeable, but he migh..."
links.text: It's barely noticeable, but he might be *a bit* annoyed at your rudeness. Then he lets it go -- more important matters need tending to.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "You realize he is waiting for your..."
links.text: You realize he is waiting for your name.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "On the sleeve of his bomber jacket..."
links.text: On the sleeve of his bomber jacket -- as well as on its back -- are enigmatic white rectangles.

dialogueTree.text: A bespectacled man in an orange bomber jacket is tapping his foot on the floor. Looks like he's waiting for someone -- you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "As you approach, he narrows his eye..."
links.text: As you approach, he narrows his eyes and extends his hand in greeting.
